title: Fan (possibly USA), 1850–70
medium:
Medium: parchment, bone, mother-of-pearl
Technique: painted parchment
creditline: Museum purchase from Eleanor G. Hewitt and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds
description: The fan leaf is two sided parchment with a design of birds and flowers. The sticks are drilled and pierced bone with a mother-of pearl washer and metal loop at the rivet. The leaf depicts a goldfinch with berries of either Bryony (a climbing vine whose berries are poisonous which grows wild in Europe) or Guelder Rose (Vibernum Opulus) a shrub that also grows wild in Europe.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan (possibly USA), 1850–70. Medium: parchment, bone, mother-of-pearl
Technique: painted parchment. 
Museum purchase from Eleanor G. Hewitt and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds. 1997-155-1
